title: create-sibling --since doesn't "recurse" correctly
body:
So -- there were some glitches with using released version (0.4.1) and I have swallowed the bullet and installed current development (whoohoo! 0.4.1.dev452)
It could well be that it is misbehaving due to prior failures to create sibling by released version (used bundled git, .git/hooks wasn't created, didn't work it all out properly), but doesn't look like it -- looks more like not considering "-r" flag at all and not getting all the needed changes:  since I have just added the submodule on the top level (Wheatley), sure thing it should process as well all of its submodules, but it seems it doesn't care -- I have tried with various # of steps to go back in --since:
```shell
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ datalad --dbg create-sibling -r --shared group --existing=skip -s rolando --since=HEAD^^^ ssh://rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu/inbox/BIDS
[INFO   ] Skipping dataset with an already configured sibling 'rolando': [] 
[INFO   ] Connecting ... 
[INFO   ] Creating target dataset /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley at /inbox/BIDS/Wheatley 
[INFO   ] Adjusting remote git configuration 
[INFO   ] Enabling git post-update hook ... 
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ datalad --dbg create-sibling -r --shared group --existing=skip -s rolando --since=HEAD^^^ ssh://rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu/inbox/BIDS 
[INFO   ] Skipping dataset with an already configured sibling 'rolando': [u'/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley'] 
[INFO   ] No datasets qualify for sibling creation. Consider different settings for --existing or --since if this is unexpected 
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ git diff --stat HEAD^^^ 
 .gitmodules | 3 +++
 Wheatley    | 2 +-
 2 files changed, 4 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ datalad --dbg create-sibling -r --shared group --existing=skip -s rolando --since=HEAD^^^^ ssh://rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu/inbox/BIDS 
[INFO   ] Skipping dataset with an already configured sibling 'rolando': [u'/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley'] 
[INFO   ] No datasets qualify for sibling creation. Consider different settings for --existing or --since if this is unexpected 
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ git diff --stat HEAD^^^^^
 .gitmodules | 3 +++                                                             
 Wheatley    | 1 +
 dbic        | 2 +-
 3 files changed, 5 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ datalad --dbg create-sibling -r --shared group --existing=skip -s rolando --since=HEAD^^^^^ ssh://rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu/inbox/BIDS 
[INFO   ] Skipping datasets with an already configured sibling 'rolando': [u'/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/dbic', u'/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley'] 
[INFO   ] No datasets qualify for sibling creation. Consider different settings for --existing or --since if this is unexpected 
```
the only workaround which worked was to provide empty value for `--since` thus signaling to just consider all things.  FWIW -- that worked out beautifully and skipped existing ones at once -- very lovely! (didn't like the too long message though listing them all... I might butcher it)
